snippet: Keith L. Sachs and his wife, Katherine, have promised much of their art collection to the Philadelphia Museum of Art, including works by Jasper Johns, Ellsworth Kelly, Brice Marden and Gerhard Richter.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Philadelphia Museum of Art will receive large donation of art from collection of Keith L Sachs that is estimated to be worth nearly $70 million; Sotheby's will sell works from estate of Jan Krugier at Impressionist and modern art auctions in London; Andrea Fiuczynski resigns as president of Christie’s in Los Angeles to take job with Sotheby's.
lead_paragraph: Keith L. Sachs and his wife, Katherine, have promised much of their art collection to the Philadelphia Museum of Art, including works by Jasper Johns, Ellsworth Kelly, Brice Marden and Gerhard Richter.

headline.main: Philadelphia Museum Lands a Major Gift
